verses.roman:
tumi baḍa paṇḍita, mahākavi-śiromaṇi
yāṅra mukhe bāhirāya aiche kavya-vāṇī

synonyms: tumi—you; baḍa paṇḍita—greatly learned scholar; mahā-kavi—of all great poets; śiromaṇi—the topmost; yāṅra—of whom; mukhe—in the mouth; bāhirāya—emanates; aiche—such; kāvya-vāṇī—poetic language.
translation: "You are the most learned scholar and the topmost of all great poets, for otherwise how could such fine poetry come from your mouth?
